metadata.title: CVE-2020-8201 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Node.js < 12.18.4 and < 14.11 can be exploited to perform HTTP desyncattacks and deliver malicious payloads to unsuspecting users. The payloadscan be crafted by an attacker to hijack user sessions, poison cookies,perform clickjacking, and a multitude of other attacks depending on thearchitecture of the underlying system. The attack was possible due to a bugin processing of carrier-return symbols in the HTTP header names.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3
nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3').
